ptychodactyl.camera¶

Examples:

Camera model

Dependencies

S805MU1

stable, preferred

Thorlabs camera SDK

Andor

DO936N

not yet implemented

Mightex

SME-B050-U

buggy

Mightex camera software package

Controller classes for cameras.

camera.get_camera(camera_type, **kwargs)¶

Set up the stages with the correct controller class.

Parameters

  • camera_type (str) – Type of stages to set up.

  • kwargs – keyword arguments associated with type of stages

Returns

Stage controller object, subclass of stages.Stage

Return type

Stage

class camera.Camera(defaults, verbose)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract parent class for camera devices

get_frames(num_frames=1, show=False)¶

Collect a composite image from the camera.

Parameters

  • num_frames (int) – Camera will sum this many frames into the composite image

  • show (bool) – If True, show the image (log scale) and a histogram of the image data.

Returns

2D image array

Return type

np.ndarray

static imshow(image)¶

A compact wrapper for pyplot’s imshow with some commonly desired parameters preloaded

print(text)¶

A wrapper for print() that checks whether the instance is set to verbose

set_defaults()¶

Sets the basic camera features to their basic values.

set_resolution(resolution)¶

Set camera resolution. The functionality of this is a little counter-intuitive. The resolution parameter is the side-length of the desired diffraction data. This method will set the camera to bin each image as much as possible without reducing the height or width below resolution. The data will be cropped to the right size in CollectData.finalize() before saving. The binning happens here to reduce runtime memory usage, but the cropping has to happen there because it needs to be centered on the diffraction patterns.

Parameters

resolution (int) – Desired side length of diffraction data.

find_center()¶

Finds and returns the “center of mass” for the camera’s image sensor. Useful for finding the center of a beam or diffraction pattern.

analyze_frame()¶

Take an image, then show the image, the center of brightness, and the centered horizontal and vertical line readouts.

class camera.ThorCam(verbose=True)¶

Bases: camera.Camera

Camera subclass that can interface with a Thorlabs camera.

This subclass only implements a few basic functions which are relevant to ptychography data collection. A more complete control can be achieved by using the officially provided SDK.

__init__(verbose=True)¶

Create a ThorCam object

Parameters

verbose (bool) – if True (default), this instance will print information about most processes as it runs.

camera_on()¶

Turns on the camera

camera_off()¶

Turns off the camera

set_exposure(ms)¶

Set the camera exposure time in milliseconds.

Parameters

ms (float) – exposure time in milliseconds

set_gain(gain)¶

Set the camera analog gain

Parameters

gain (int) – analog gain

arm()¶
get_frame()¶
disarm()¶
class camera.Mightex(verbose=True)¶

Bases: camera.Camera

Camera subclass that can interface with a Mightex camera.

This subclass only implements a few basic functions which are relevant to ptychography data collection. A more complete control can be achieved by using the officially provided SDK.

__init__(verbose=True)¶

Create a Mightex object.

Parameters

verbose (bool) – if True, this instance will print information about most processes as it runs. Default is True

camera_on()¶

Start the camera engine

camera_off()¶

Stop the camera engine

set_resolution(resolution)¶

Set camera resolution.

Parameters

resolution ((int, int)) – Desired camera resolution (width, height)

set_exposure(ms)¶

Set camera exposure time.

Parameters

ms (float) – exposure time in milliseconds

set_gain(gain)¶

Set camera gain.

Parameters

gain (int) – gain factor in eighths (e.g. gain of 8 corresponds to 1x gain)

arm()¶
get_frame()¶
disarm()¶
get_frames(num_frames=1, show=False)¶

Collect images from the camera.

Parameters

  • num_frames (int) – number of frames to collect. Currently has no effect

  • show (bool) – if True, show the image before returning it

Returns

2D image array

Return type

np.ndarray
